    • Constructor Detail

      • ldap

        public ldap(ic9engine Eng,
            java.lang.String Host,
            java.lang.String Root,
            java.lang.String UserName,
            java.lang.String Password,
            int Port)
        Default constructor takes an instance of the ic9engine object and a variety of configuration information. If the user name contains a forward slash as used with Windows Active Directory (ex: jsmith/somecompany) then the root parameter is unused and the user name is used by iteslf. If not then the user name is a combination of the user name and the root (ex: cn=[UserName],[Root]).

        So if the bind DN is: cn=read-only-admin,dc=example,dc=com you would pass the following.
        UserName = 'read-only-admin'
        Root = 'dc=example,dc=com'

        For active directory with user jsmith at domain somecompany you would pass the following.
        UserName = 'jsmith/somecompany'
        Root = ''
        Parameters:
        Eng - Is an instance of the ic9engine object.
        Host - Is a String with the LDAP/AD host to connect to.
        Root - Is a String with the root part of the DN or blank.
        UserName - Is a String with the user name.
        Password - Is a String with the password.
        Port - Is an int with the host port number to connect to.
